name: Compact Microsoft Teams for Dark theme
description:
*NOTE 16/06* I know the new "emoji reaction" is broken, will update in a few days.

Compact mode for Microsoft Teams: Use full screen width; remove name/date headers on each message; remove alternating left/right display of messages.

This customization applies to the "Dark" theme of Microsoft Teams. See other styles from me for Condensed mode and light themes.
additional_info: Changelog 2018-10-23 * Decrease left-padding in compact mode 2018-10-06 * Hide placeholders glitch * Fix editor size in threads * Actions menu moved outside of message in threads 2018-10-03 * Better action-menu alignment Compact view styles for Microsoft Teams Browser styles to make Microsoft Teams more compact. Compact, Condensed, light and dark Two classes of style are provided: * Compact style: removes wasted space (use full screen width, hide repeated headers), keeps avatars. * Condensed style: removes wasted space, replace avatars by textual names, reduces padding/margin around text for maximal density. In the new styles, some of the css elements have been moved outside of their parent box. In the original Microsoft style they were transparent, but now they must be assigned an explicit background color. Since this depends of the Light or Dark theme used, the new styles have been duplicated to be customized for each of Light and Dark theme; chose the one for your theme. Compact style The compact style features the following changes: * Use the full screen width: Long messages now take the whole available screen instead of being restricted to a fixed-width center column. * Author and Date of message are hidden by default: the "header" showing the name of the poster and the time, is removed from each message, and only shows above the message on mouse-hover. * Action menu (option, save, like) is moved on the right, outside of the message zone, to avoid hiding the end of the text. * No alternating "chat bubble": In chat view, your messages are aligned on the left like all other messages. Compact style can achieve +25% displayed messages in chat. Condensed style The condensed style contains most of the features of the compact style, plus: * Removed avatar; poster name is now on the left in place of the avatar, always displayed unlike the compact mode. Time is shown on mouse-hover. * Decreased padding and margin around text for maximum number of displayed messages per screen. Condensed style can easily achieve +100% displayed messages in one-on-one chat; a bit less in threaded team views. Known bugs * Alignement problems, especially in condensed style, where some elements like the "Edited" indicator are visually showing in front of the wrong message. * Many elements that had transparent backgrounds, have been moved outside of there parent div, and may not all have an explicit background color set. This will create some style incoherence. * Elements moved outside of their parent also are not always cleanly aligned * Elements shown "above" on hover, may not be visible on the very first message. TODO Nice to have features planned for the future: * In Condensed style, show the avatar, with its detail popup, on hover. * Hide the Reply button in Teams chat
